member.summary: Wrapped list object.

member.name: F:ThreadSafeList`1._lock
member.summary: Lock object to use for all operations.

member.name: M:ThreadSafeList`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes the first occurrence of a specific object from the ThreadSafeList<T>.
member.param: The object to remove from the ThreadSafeList<T>. The value can be null for reference types.
member.returns: true if item is successfully removed; otherwise, false. This method also returns false if item was not found in the ThreadSafeList<T>.

member.name: P:ThreadSafeList`1.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the list is read only. Returns true.

member.name: P:ThreadSafeList`1.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of elements actually contained in the ThreadSafeList<T>.

member.name: M:ThreadSafeList`1.CopyTo(`0[])
member.summary: Copies the entire ThreadSafeList<T> to a compatible one-dimensional array, starting at the beginning of the target array.
member.param: The one-dimensional System.Array that is the destination of the elements copied from System.Collections.Generic.List<T>. The System.Array must have zero-based indexing.
member.exception: The number of elements in the source ThreadSafeList<T> is greater than the number of elements that the destination array can contain.

member.name: M:ThreadSafeList`1.CopyTo(`0[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the entire ThreadSafeList<T> to a compatible one-dimensional array, starting at the beginning of the target array.
member.param: The one-dimensional System.Array that is the destination of the elements copied from ThreadSafeList<T>. The System.Array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
member.exception: The number of elements in the source ThreadSafeList<T> is greater than the available space from arrayIndex to the end of the destination array.

member.name: M:ThreadSafeList`1.Contains(`0)
member.summary: Determines whether an element is in the ThreadSafeList<T>.
member.param: The object to locate in the ThreadSafeList<T>. The value can be null for reference types.
member.returns: true if item is found in the ThreadSafeList<T>; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ThreadSafeList`1.Clear
member.summary: Removes all elements from the ThreadSafeList<T>.

member.summary: Adds an object to the end of the ThreadSafeList<T>.

member.summary: Gets or sets the element at the specified index.
member.param: The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
member.returns: The element at the specified index.

member.name: M:ThreadSafeList`1.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the element at the specified index of the ThreadSafeList<T>.
member.param: The zero-based index of the element to remove.
member.exception: Index is less than 0.-or-index is equal to or greater than ThreadSafeList<T>.Count.

member.name: M:ThreadSafeList`1.Insert(System.Int32,`0)
member.summary: Inserts an element into the ThreadSafeList<T> at the specified index.
member.param: The zero-based index at which item should be inserted.
The object to insert. The value can be null for reference types.
member.exception: Index is less than 0.-or-index is greater than ThreadSafeList<T>.Count.

member.name: M:ThreadSafeList`1.IndexOf(`0)
member.summary: Searches for the specified object and returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence within the entire ThreadSafeList<T>.
member.param: The object to locate in the ThreadSafeList<T>. The value can be null for reference types.
member.returns: The zero-based index of the first occurrence of item within the entire ThreadSafeList<T>, if found; otherwise, â€“1.

member.name: M:ThreadSafeList`1.AddRange(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1{`0})
member.summary: Adds the elements of the specified collection to the end of the ThreadSafeList<T>.
member.param: The collection whose elements should be added to the end of the ThreadSafeList<T>. The collection itself cannot be null, but it can contain elements that are null, if type T is a reference type.

member.name: M:ThreadSafeList`1.ThreadSafeEnumerator.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the collection.

member.exception: The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.
